dk.statsbiblioteket.util.i18n
Class Translator

java.lang.Object
  dk.statsbiblioteket.util.i18n.Translator

@QAInfo(state=QA_NEEDED,
        level=NORMAL)
public class Translator
extends java.lang.Object

Convenience class to ease usage of resource bundles for translation purposes.

Note: ResourceBundle does internal caching of the parsed bundles so there is not need for a static factory for this class.

See Also:
BundleCache, ResourceBundle

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_LOCALE

public static final java.util.Locale DEFAULT_LOCALE
Default Locale. Used in case no bundle is found for the provided locale.

Constructor Detail

Translator

public Translator(java.lang.String bundleName,
                  java.util.Locale locale)

Create a Translator for a named ResourceBundle and a given Locale.

If no resource bundle matching the request can be found this class will try to fall back to the DEFAULT_LOCALE. If this fails too it will fall back to an empty resource bundle. This means that all requests to translate(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...) will return a String where '.' is replaced by a white space. See translate(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...) documentation.

Parameters:
bundleName - the name of the ResourceBundle to look up
locale - the locale to translate to

Translator

public Translator(java.util.Locale locale)
Create a Translator for the DEFAULT_BUNDLE. See Translator(String, java.util.Locale) for fallback strategy.

Parameters:
locale -
Method Detail

translate

public java.lang.String translate(java.lang.String key,
                                  java.lang.Object... values)

Return translation corresponding to a given key. If the key is not found in the underlying ResourceBundle the string with periods replaced by white spaces will be returned.

Because of the above described fallback behavior it is strongly advised to make translation keys in the reverse format. Ie replace white spaces by periods.

If the key is not found this will be reported to the log on the first occurence only. This is to avoid flooding the log with translation warnings.

Parameters:
key - the key to lookup translation for.
values - the values to replace in the translated string
Returns:
the translated string - or best effort described as above.

getBundle

public java.util.ResourceBundle getBundle()
Get the bundle used for translation. Note that this may be an empty bundle in case none was found.

Returns:
